results.title: Heidi Halloween
results.brief_description: Heidi Klum is known for her dedication to halloween costumes, having previously dressed as the ogre version of Fiona from Shrek, Jessica Rabbit, and even an alien science experiment gone wrong. In 2022 she outdid herself, dressing in full-body prosthetics to party as an earthworm, while husband Tom Kaulitz dressed as a fisherman. The committed costume set social media abuzz as the internet considered that Klum finally had a concrete answer to the age-old question: would you still love me if I was a worm?
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Heidi Klum is known for her dedication to halloween costumes, having previously dressed as the ogre version of Fiona from Shrek, Jessica Rabbit and even an alien science experiment gone wrong. In 2022 she outdid herself, dressing in full-body prosthetics to party as an earthworm, while husband Tom Kaulitz dressed as a fisherman. The committed costume set social media abuzz as the internet considered that Klum finally had a concrete answer to the age-old question: would you still love me if I was a worm?
description_for_label: Heidi Klum is known for her dedication to halloween costumes, having previously dressed as the ogre version of Fiona from Shrek, Jessica Rabbit and even an alien science experiment gone wrong. In 2022 she outdid herself, dressing in full-body prosthetics to party as an earthworm, while husband Tom Kaulitz dressed as a fisherman. The committed costume set social media abuzz as the internet considered that Klum finally had a concrete answer to the age-old question: would you still love me if I was a worm? More so, Klum’s elaborate costumes also pay homage to the movie-making magic of prosthetics and make-up.

results.title: Night cries: a rural tragedy
results.brief_description: In Tracey Moffatt’s re-imaging of the pivotal Australian film “Jedda”, a middle-aged Aboriginal woman returns to her outback home to nurse her dying white mother. Filmed against lushly coloured sets that recall the technicolour glories of the past, and utilising a harsh discordant soundscape, “Night Cries” occupies the landscape of dreams and the classic mythic terrain of familial violence and betrayal. This short film does more than simply reconfigure and re-imagine past narratives. It inaugurated a clear and permament break with previous moving image representations of the “outback”: no longer the pretence that it is a place outside language and history.

results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot: the letter Z runs away
results.brief_description: Written and produced by an Early Childhood teacher in Queensland, this tape is aimed at assisting young children in developing literacy and numeracy skills. The video is interactive, allowing young children to discover and learn through literacy and numeracy experiences, and the fantasy story encompasses songs that are supported by 3D visual effects, thus creating a fun learning environment that further develops confidence and success. Areas covered include; spatial and positional word vocabulary and relationships, numbers, the alphabet, fine motor movements, self esteem, music and movement. ‘The Adventures of Floss the Fairy and Riddley Robot’ will entertain and educate children aged 7 months to 7 years.

results.title: Frontline
results.creator_credit: David Bradbury, Australian War Memorial, Tasmanian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, British Broadcasting Corporation and ABC
results.brief_description:
An account of the Vietnam War as seen through the camera of the late Australian war correspondent, Neil Davis. David Bradbury’s multi-award winning documentary also examines the ethical issues facing a man in the frontline who is not an active combatant.
Vietnam was a television war, a war said to have been lost in the lounge rooms of middle America, and not on the battlefield. This film explores the conflict, and Davis’ involvement in it, combining his original footage, comments and archival film. It includes the famous, historic footage of the fall of Saigon, which Davis was the only Western journalist to film.

results.title: Yoram Gross : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with producer Yoram Gross for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Yoram Gross founded the Yoram Gross Film Studio and was known for his work on animated films and TV series including “Blinky Bill”, the “Dot” series, and “The Magic Riddle”.

results.title: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with screenwriters Sue Smith and John Alsop for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Sue Smith and John Alsop are screenwriters and playwrights who have collaborated on productions such as “My Brother Jack”, “Brides of Christ”, “Bordertown” and “The Leaving of Liverpool”.
